doc:
John Craven (actor) https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/John_Craven_(actor) 0 John Craven (June 22, 1916 – November 24, 1995) was an American actor, and the son of noted character actor Frank Craven. He appeared in films and numerous plays and had many TV roles, but was best remembered for originating the role of George Gibbs in the original stage version of Our Town, in which his father played the role of the Stage Manager. Craven was overlooked in the movie version, however, with the part going to the then-unknown William Holden. Though born in New York City, he attended Beverly Hills High School, in the early 1930s. His stage family had a long history of alternating generations of men named John with subsequent generations of men named Frank. John_Craven ( June_22_,_1916 – November_24_,_1995 ) was an_American_actor , and the_son of noted_character_actor_Frank_Craven . He appeared in films and numerous_plays and had many_TV_roles , but was_best_remembered for originating the_role of George_Gibbs in the_original_stage_version of Our_Town , in which his_father played the_role of the_Stage_Manager . Craven was_overlooked in the_movie_version , however , with the_part going to the_then-unknown_William_Holden . Though born in New_York_City , he attended Beverly_Hills_High_School , in the_early_1930s . His_stage_family had a_long_history of alternating generations of men named John with subsequent_generations of men named Frank .
